title.narrative: 3.3. PUBLIC FINANCE FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: Output 3.3: By the end of 2021, national capacities on child-sensitive public financial analysis and management are strengthened., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children (Covid), Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3: By the end of 2021, the most disadvantaged children benefit from enhanced evidence-based and integrated social protection and poverty reduction policies, programmes and institutions

participating-org.narrative: VEZARAT TAAVON KAR VA REFAHE EJTEMA

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Support to other social protection programs: Child care and early childhood development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.3: By the end of 2021, national capacities on child-sensitive public financial analysis and management are strengthened.

description.narrative: UNICEF Iran Country Office (ICO) contributed to strengthening the national capacities on child-sensitive public financial analysis and management through partnership with Ministry of Cooperative Labour and Social Welfare (MCLSW) and the Ministry of Health & Medical Education (MOHME) despite contextual challenges which to date prevented formal signing of the interventions planned with the Planning and Budget Organization (PBO) since late last year. The ground is laid to use opportunities for evidence-based, cost-effective and coordinated policies and programmes for better investment for children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/08/2020

title.narrative: Level of use of child-sensitive/child-focused budget and expenditure analyses to plan and monitor public finance in social sectors
